info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 5:40PM CDT until March 30 at 2:19PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ELMORE...NORTHWESTERN MACON AND NORTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 540 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Tysonville, or 7 miles southwest of Milstead, moving northeast at 30 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR SHORTER AND MILSTEAD. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Tuskegee, Tallassee, Milstead, Shorter, Franklin, Tysonville, Victoryland, Waugh, Uphapee Creek, Brassell, Moton Field Municipal Airport, Yates Dam and Yates Reservoir. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
